fields.customfield_12310192:
The patch updates the HDFS default HTTP/RPC ports to non-ephemeral ports. The changes are listed below:
Namenode ports: 50470 --> 9871, 50070 --> 9870, 8020 --> 9820
Secondary NN ports: 50091 --> 9869, 50090 --> 9868
Datanode ports: 50020 --> 9867, 50010 --> 9866, 50475 --> 9865, 50075 --> 9864

fields.description: HDFS defaults to ephemeral ports for the some HTTP/RPC endpoints. This can cause bind exceptions on service startup if the port is in use.
fields.summary: HDFS should not default to ephemeral ports

comments.body: This issue has been a pet peeve of mine for years.  But every time this topic comes up, someone complains that this makes testing on a single node hard.  I really, really, really hope we're over that hump and we can not only remove the default of being ephemeral but also set the ports to be a contiguous range.
+1, let's make this happen. Seems long overdue to me.
HBASE-10123 could be useful as reference.

Thanks [~iwasakims] for the pointer.  The numbers started with 9000 suggested by [~vinayrpet] are safe on various OS according to [~jmhsieh]  [HBASE-10123 comment|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HBASE-10123?focusedCommentId=13869893&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13869893].
Posted initial patch for review, thanks. Will make chances to keep comments/docs consistent in upcoming patches.

Here's another to consider: the hadoop-kms port.  It was brought up on HBASE-10123 that it uses 16000 as default (and clashes with hbase currently)

this line indicates that 16000 is the default -- likely a search for that ENV variable will find where it is set by default in the code or confs.
https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/trunk/hadoop-common-project/hadoop-kms/src/main/conf/kms-env.sh#L25

bq. How about changing into something like below? Just replace 50 with 9

No. Let's actually move the ports to be contiguous instead of all over the place.  It's extremely sloppy and highlights the community's inability to plan to have these giant gaps all over the place.
001 changed comments/docs/sources that were inconsistent.

I haven't looked at the patch in detail yet but I am +1 on the assignments (thanks for the nice summary).

I will hold off committing until late next week at least to give the Jira watchers a chance to comment.

Thanks [~xiaobingo] for working on this.

Have we considered about moving NN's RPC port to the same range? Now NN HTTP/HTTPS are on 9870/9871, while RPC on 8020. DN has HTTP/HTTPS on 9864/9865 while IPC on 9867. I think this jira is a good chance to bring the NN RPC to the same range. Please let me know your thoughts.

Nit: I see one reference of 50070 in CommandsManual.md in an example, could you please update that?

I posted patch v005 your comments, thanks [~xiaochen] for review. Here's mapping in the following.

I intentionally have 9820 being not strictly contiguous with other NN ports in a sense people easily remember 9820 as they are more familiar with 8020 thanks to [~arpiagariu] pointed me based on such a spirit.

I didn't see any 50070 reference in CommandsManual.md, which's already fixed in the patches.

Namenode ports 
---------------- 
50470 --> 9871
50070 --> 9870
8020   --> 9820

Secondary NN ports 
--------------- 
50091 --> 9869
50090 --> 9868

Datanode ports 
--------------- 
50020 --> 9867
50010 --> 9866
50475 --> 9865
50075 --> 9864
Thanks [~xiaobingo] for the new rev, LGTM. +1 (non-binding).
